title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: Many people think that the more you go to school the more you will be able to understand the world. They think that going to university makes you become an open-minded person. At university you learn theory - ideas and concepts - but what will theory be useful for you if you haven't any practice - facts? For example, I am a civil engineering student and at school I'm learning about the science of structures or how to calculate the rate of steel you have to put in concrete to make a good prestressed concrete? The theory looks pretty good. However in fact when you are on a site, working all that theory is not helpful. It's only the experience that will give you a good rate of steel. Even if I think that understanding the concept of prestressed concrete is very important, only the facts will show you how to be a good civil engineer. To illustrate, I will give my example. Last summer I did a training course in a house building company. Even if I had studied civil engineering for one year, I was unable to give orders to plumbers or electricians or other handworkers because I didn't know in fact, in reality, on the site, how they could execute the plans. I think that concepts and facts must be taught together. You have to understand the concepts and to know what they are related to in the real world. It's important to always be connected to reality. An idea without its application can be misunderstood. Speaking of AIDS without speaking of the real dangers in all countries, without speaking of Africa's problems could make a student think that it can't happen to him, that it is a rare disease, that he's not concerned.
sents: ["Many people think that the more you go to school the more you will be able to understand the world. They think that going to university makes you become an open-minded person. At university you learn theory - ideas and concepts - but what will theory be useful for you if you haven't any practice - facts? For example, I am a civil engineering student and at school I'm learning about the science of structures or how to calculate the rate of steel you have to put in concrete to make a good prestressed concrete? The theory looks pretty good. However in fact when you are on a site, working all that theory is not helpful. It's only the experience that will give you a good rate of steel. Even if I think that understanding the concept of prestressed concrete is very important, only the facts will show you how to be a good civil engineer. To illustrate, I will give my example. Last summer I did a training course in a house building company. Even if I had studied civil engineering for one year, I was unable to give orders to plumbers or electricians or other handworkers because I didn't know in fact, in reality, on the site, how they could execute the plans. I think that concepts and facts must be taught together. You have to understand the concepts and to know what they are related to in the real world. It's important to always be connected to reality. An idea without its application can be misunderstood.", "Speaking of AIDS without speaking of the real dangers in all countries, without speaking of Africa's problems could make a student think that it can't happen to him, that it is a rare disease, that he's not concerned."]

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: In my view, the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. I do not prefer to travel alone as i believe that when you travel with friends then you can take the most pleasure and information from the trip as there will be many questions for the tour guide as there will be many brains, not one. I just want to emphasise this by using an example of my trip with my friends. I am a history student by profession. In the last year of my college I had a thesis to be submitted on a Great monument, Taj Mahal. It was a tour where a group of 4 (including me) had gone and the place was to New Delhi, in India where Taj Mahal is located. It is one of the ancient cities in India with great history and also the capital of the country. There we hired a tour guide, who is believed to be the best in the place. While looking at the monument and hearing the information from the guide, we were astonished at the history, beauty and the efforts required for its construction. There were a lot of areas in the monuments whose names were not even heard by us before i. e.

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: I agree that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. There are some reasons why students should learn and understand ideas and concepts before learning facts and that they need to have a solid mental background as a basis. First, learning facts without understanding ideas and concepts is the same as making a sand castle. For example, if they use a machine or instrument for any reason without knowing the mechanism or concept, they can copy some work but they can't do creative work. Or when they encounter some problems, they can't solve anything and have to depend on other people who know the mechanism. Second, they won't be creative. They don't need to start from scratch for everything. However, once they know some concepts, they can manipulate and apply many things as they want and develop the current stage of work or improve it to make it productive. The third reason is making a good habit when they learn ideas and concepts. People who like to learn facts are usually lazy or superficial.
sents: ["I agree that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. There are some reasons why students should learn and understand ideas and concepts before learning facts and that they need to have a solid mental background as a basis. First, learning facts without understanding ideas and concepts is the same as making a sand castle. For example, if they use a machine or instrument for any reason without knowing the mechanism or concept, they can copy some work but they can't do creative work. Or when they encounter some problems, they can't solve anything and have to depend on other people who know the mechanism. Second, they won't be creative. They don't need to start from scratch for everything. However, once they know some concepts, they can manipulate and apply many things as they want and develop the current stage of work or improve it to make it productive. The third reason is making a good habit when they learn ideas and concepts.", 'People who like to learn facts are usually lazy or superficial.']

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: Developing a broad knowledge base on numerous academic subjects rather than specializing in one specific subject implies acquiring knowledge for the purpose of striving for quantity rather than quality. In my opinion, broad knowledge complements or rather acts as a foundation of specialization rather than being more favourable than specializing in one specific subject. Broad knowledge of many academic subjects has been emphasized during our early years of education since it provides students with a basis or tool to raise awareness of things occurring around them and a backbone to further develop their knowledge database. It also acts as an appetizer for people to explore different areas of knowledge and discover one that they are willing to dwell deeper into. In addition, it secures a certain level of literacy among the population since people have sufficient knowledge to handle daily matters. However, knowledge is about gaining in depth rather than having a broad yet shallow base. Broad knowledge is similar to information which is easily lost and can hardly be sustained. It is by specialization in one specific subject that knowledge can be thoroughly researched, experimented, evolutioned and make a difference to the world we live in. Civilizations take huge strides forward due to the innovation of pioneers who are specialists in their respective subjects. Multinational pharmaceutical companies invest billions in research and development to sponsor laboratory experiments in developing new medicines that can treat diseases such as AIDS and malaria.
sents: ['Developing a broad knowledge base on numerous academic subjects rather than specializing in one specific subject implies acquiring knowledge for the purpose of striving for quantity rather than quality. In my opinion, broad knowledge complements or rather acts as a foundation of specialization rather than being more favourable than specializing in one specific subject. Broad knowledge of many academic subjects has been emphasized during our early years of education since it provides students with a basis or tool to raise awareness of things occurring around them and a backbone to further develop their knowledge database. It also acts as an appetizer for people to explore different areas of knowledge and discover one that they are willing to dwell deeper into. In addition, it secures a certain level of literacy among the population since people have sufficient knowledge to handle daily matters. However, knowledge is about gaining in depth rather than having a broad yet shallow base. Broad knowledge is similar to information which is easily lost and can hardly be sustained. It is by specialization in one specific subject that knowledge can be thoroughly researched, experimented, evolutioned and make a difference to the world we live in. Civilizations take huge strides forward due to the innovation of pioneers who are specialists in their respective subjects.', 'Multinational pharmaceutical companies invest billions in research and development to sponsor laboratory experiments in developing new medicines that can treat diseases such as AIDS and malaria.']

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: Today, when we look at our environment we can see many more cars than in olden times we could see. I disagree that in twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. In passing years, it is observed that the number of cars is increasing fast. I want to focus on reasons to increase cars. The first reason is that the population is growing. Many people start to use their individual cars. All families buy cars for their children or young people buy cars by themselves. For example, in Turkey many families who have 3 or 4 members have at least 3 cars. However, many companies start to improve themselves. They use many cars for their jobs,especially for sales and marketing. They should sell or do their job by car. Another reason is that cars always seem to make people very comfortable. All people want to have a car. Cars are comfortable because, you can go wherever you want, you do not have problems like missing buses and being late for school or work. You are free in a car, because it is yours you can listen to music highly. Although other transporters are produced or the government makes some campaigns for their costs, people do not use these transporters such as trains andbuses. etc.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: As I'm Italian, I can maintain that this statement is probably wrong: actually, my personal experience shows that the trend is the opposite. When I was a child, there were only one car per family and you could have seen the same situation when my parents were young. If you have lived in the early-Fourties of the last century, probably you couldn't afford a car: only rich people had one.

When I was a child, there were only one car per family and you could have seen the same situation when my parents were young.", "If you have lived in the early-Fourties of the last century, probably you couldn't afford a car: only rich people had one."]

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: As I'm Italian, I can maintain that this statement is probably wrong: actually, my personal experience shows that the trend is the opposite. When I was a child, there were only one car per family and you could have seen the same situation when my parents were young. If you have lived in the early-Fourties of the last century, probably you couldn't afford a car: only rich people had one. Now, let's take a look at today's situation, cars are everywhere! I don't want to condemn this trend - I own a car too - but that's a matter of fact and, I think, in the future it will be one of the main issues on every politician's agenda. You can find many reasons to explain why everyone wants a car Nevertheless,'m virtually I'm virtually sure that it is due to the travelling with trainsaround with trains, buses and taxis - and the latter are very expensive here in Italy. If you have a date, surely you don't wish to be late, but if you take a train, you can never know when you will arrive nor if you will arrive in the right place. I think it's time to introduce an example. Today there is my TOEFL test Nonetheless, public drivers have made up their minds to strike.

I don't want to condemn this trend - I own a car too - but that's a matter of fact and, I think, in the future it will be one of the main issues on every politician's agenda. title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: In today's modern life every individual wants to understand and be able to estimate the ideas and concepts of the other person. By which he improvises his ideas and overcome withbetterideas than the other person. So I agree with the statement that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. I would like to support this statement for the following reasons. First, By understanding the ideas and concepts we get a clear image of the aspect. For example if we are studying a particular subject. In that subject it is important for us to identify the main idea of the topic and the concept involved in that particular topic. By simply learning the subject without understanding the concepts then it will be a mystery for us that subject even if we spend a lot of time on that. second,By understanding the ideas and concepts we are able to know how to live in society. That means we are capable of dealing with the problems and our clients. For example if we want to drive a car, we must first understand the ideas and concepts that mean how to start the car ,how to accelerate ,how to movegears.

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: The question asks about chemistry. In my opinion academic subjects are better to have broad knowledge than to specialize in one specific subject. There are several reasons shown at the bottom, why i disagree. First, the world is developing really fast. A century ago people thought a specific subject was more important than academic subjects. Also number of people still think a specific subject is more important than anacademic subject. I would say that is wrong. If you have a job like writer, musical job, artist or singer that might be better to have broad knowledge of a specific subject. But the world is developing really fast people need to follow the technology. There are how to learn many academic subjects. School in one of good cases. Most of the high school in Korea which I was from, learn more mathematics , physics , chemistry, Biology or computers. I believe the school is better for learning knowledge than other  schools. Second, I will give a different example. Korea has good IT technology. So most people work in the computer part or the science part. There are several examples of academic knowledge. The company also needs employees. The employees also have to have enough knowledge. In case I have a computer company. I need 5 people to work in my factory which makes CPUs.

title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: I do not agree with the assertion because there are more opportunities nowadays for young people to help their communities. With the advent of the Internet or other media, people have become easier to get information that their community needs them to help. For example, in my apartment, the members of the committee announce the advertisement on our community website when they need people to help set up a certain event. And they often receive a lot of responses that say they would like to help. Compared to the past, there are few people informed that they need to help something. Thus, I think more and more young people are involved in community activities because they are more familiar with the internet than the people before, and understand they are in demand. In addition, in my school, university always encourage students to do something that can benefit our community or society. For example, they are encouraged to clean the streets and help teach older people who are illiterate to read. Universities do not pay the students that do service for the community.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: I agree with the statement about traveling with a tourguide with a group is the best way. For the following reasons. You can learn lots of information about the famous places. title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: At the moment there are just enough cars on the street. The streets are overfilled and it is more and more difficult to find a parking space, especially if you are in trouble. The city is polluted by cars and the air becomes more and more dirty with every day. Furthermore it becomes more difficult to pay for the car and petrol. The "hobby car", is like a very expensive hobby and in the future only rich people will have the comfort of using them. As a conclusion, the customer will look around for new products which are more attractive and the provider (the car-producer) have to react quickly, if they want to survive on the world market.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: The issue at hand is whether young people enjoy life more than older people do or not. I disagree with the idea that young people enjoy life more than older people do. I believe that older people like life more than young people do for many reasons. First of all, old people enjoy life more than younger people do because they know they are very close to death. They know very well the meaning of death and they will die at anytime. For this reason, they try to spend their rest of their lives very effectively. On the other hand, young people feel that they never die and because of this, they are n't aware of the value of life. Additionally, old people like life more than younger people because they have many reasons to enjoy life. For example, they generally have children and a wife. They need to care about them. They enjoy life because of her family. On the other hand, young people do not have a daughter or son. They are single. Because they do not have any concrete reason to glue life, they do not enjoy life more than older people. Finally, I think old people enjoy life more than younger people because their expectations of life are not generally big. They generally expect a quiet place in peace with their family. This is enough for them to enjoy life. On the other hand, as I am a young man, I have many expectations from life and if I don't obtain any of them, I will easily hate life and I will be depressed. I expect a good job, a lot of money, a brand new car.
sents: ["The issue at hand is whether young people enjoy life more than older people do or not. I disagree with the idea that young people enjoy life more than older people do. I believe that older people like life more than young people do for many reasons. First of all, old people enjoy life more than younger people do because they know they are very close to death. They know very well the meaning of death and they will die at anytime. For this reason, they try to spend their rest of their lives very effectively. On the other hand, young people feel that they never die and because of this, they are n't aware of the value of life. Additionally, old people like life more than younger people because they have many reasons to enjoy life. For example, they generally have children and a wife. They need to care about them. They enjoy life because of her family. On the other hand, young people do not have a daughter or son. They are single. Because they do not have any concrete reason to glue life, they do not enjoy life more than older people. Finally, I think old people enjoy life more than younger people because their expectations of life are not generally big. They generally expect a quiet place in peace with their family. This is enough for them to enjoy life. On the other hand, as I am a young man, I have many expectations from life and if I don't obtain any of them, I will easily hate life and I will be depressed.", 'I expect a good job, a lot of money, a brand new car.']

title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: In most cases academic education provides the possibility of a profound and distinct understanding of a certain subject in Germany. As a basis you have to take several subjects in the beginning and this leads after approximately a year to specialization into one subject. A broader knowledge of more academic subjects could have some advantages regarding more flexible and different approaches to solve a problem. However, this leads to a lack of specific details on evaluating complex problems. One might argue that with a greater diversity of subjects there will be more solutions and the person can go into detail if it is required. But this often requires a lot of time and usually companies are not willing to invest more money and additional time in educating their employees. Hence, specialization if chosen in a smart way can give the applicant for example a significant advantage. On the other hand it has to be ensured that cultural understanding and logical thinking trained by mathematical education has been provided. Therefore, schools that host students in Germany for 12 to 13 years are responsible. Education needs a lot of time implying that further unspecialized subjects are being taught at the universities it even takes longer for a student to be prepared forworking autonomously. According to the benefit of society and a person who accomplishes their studies in a shorter amount of time the conclusion I'm drawing is to ensure broad knowledge in schools and in the first year of university but then quickly turn into specific subjects. This doesn't mean limiting everyone to only one subject. In science there are lots of examples where fields overlap and knowledge of both subjects is the key to interact but it just takes too much time and resources to educate e.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: The goal of advertisements is to show products better that they really are, so i agree with the statement. If business people use advertisements it is only to increase their profits. Because  of that, they need to sell more. By consequence, they have to show that their product is the best. For example, advertisements for French cheese. A "camembert" is the same everywhere. So to increase the sales, they try to increase some aspects like more cream. So with technology and artificial characters the cheese looks better on TV or in papers but in reality it is exactly the same asbefore. When you walk on the road, and you see advertisements you are most of the time attracted by the product. For example a chocolate advertisement , with the reflection of the light on the slab, the brown color is darker so it looks better. But because the aspect of the picture is better, the products look better. So, advertisements play with your sweet taste. Depending on the moment of the year where you are, advertisers play with advertisements. For example, during the christmas period, a certain product looks better than three months ago only because there is a better or different presentation. This is the focus of an advertisement and in this case the only difference for the sale is the advertisement. If you want to raise your benefits, there is also the way : increase the need. For example for a vacuum, the used is the same everywhere but if you underline the fact that it is easy to use or easy to put a board the products lookbetter. But if you think about it a vaccum stays in a vacuum and you will use it exactly the same manner and it is the same product.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: If you want to travel, which way would you prefer to go? Joining the group in a travel agency as a tour guide or only by yourself? When we face the decision of this separation, some people would deem visiting the wonderful landscape by themselves since it will be full of myth and excitement. But for me, to be frank, I agree with attending the group. Among countless reasons which influence the choice, there are 3 conspicuous factors as follows: The first reason I agree with the statement is that traveling in a group by a helper will afford you more information about the view. For example, If you are in Hangzhou which city is famous for the West Lake, the tour guide will tell you more about resources you can not get from books or theinternet. The second factor that can be seen by every person is that the group travelling will bring you more safety. The guide will tell you which things you can do in the new place according to the local customs, and how to communicate with the local people. Those make you have a peaceful and joyous time. If you are not familiar with this, something unhappy will happen. Furthermore, travelling with a guide can save you time and energy on your journey. As we know, we only have limited time to spend our holiday. We should make good use of our time on our journey. So, company with the tour guide, you will get the most valuable information about where is the best place you have to see, and how to get the convenient way to get there. It gives you the chance to have a wonderful time. Sure, for some brave people who want to seek instinct, or specific experience , traveling alone is not a bad way to go, but you may meet unpredictable things that maybe hurt you. For most ordinary people, life is worth dying  for.
sents: ['If you want to travel, which way would you prefer to go? Joining the group in a travel agency as a tour guide or only by yourself? When we face the decision of this separation, some people would deem visiting the wonderful landscape by themselves since it will be full of myth and excitement. But for me, to be frank, I agree with attending the group. Among countless reasons which influence the choice, there are 3 conspicuous factors as follows: The first reason I agree with the statement is that traveling in a group by a helper will afford you more information about the view. For example, If you are in Hangzhou which city is famous for the West Lake, the tour guide will tell you more about resources you can not get from books or theinternet. The second factor that can be seen by every person is that the group travelling will bring you more safety. The guide will tell you which things you can do in the new place according to the local customs, and how to communicate with the local people. Those make you have a peaceful and joyous time. If you are not familiar with this, something unhappy will happen. Furthermore, travelling with a guide can save you time and energy on your journey. As we know, we only have limited time to spend our holiday. We should make good use of our time on our journey. title: It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.
text: I completely agree with that having broad knowledge of many academic subjects is better than specializing in one specific subject. I have always been someone who is interested in several academic subjects such as politics, astronomy, byology and psychology. It was not possible in my university to study all of these subjects at the same time therefore, i chose politics as a major. I believe that i would be able to be quite successful in all of them at the same time. Choose of major at univ. It depends on the person's individual interests besides other less influentialreasons. However, it can not be restricted by only one subject. A person can be successful in several subjects rather than one specific one , such as most scientists in history. Da Vinci was not only a painter but also an inventor of his age. On both of these fields his success can not be ignored. Specializing in only one specific scientific subject always sounds boring to me. Sometimes working on a person having psychological problems can be more enjoyable than studying a physical problem. Likewise, studying for politics can be more boring than working on a person's psychological problem. Therefore it can be said that we can rest while working on a different subject than the subject we had to work on a lot. Business life in my country doesnt shape with science indeed.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Over the last sixty years, advertising has increased in a huge way, in conjunction with the expansion of commerce-based societies. But it often occurs that we have the feeling that advertisements are a cheating on us by making some products better than they really are. Who never experienced buying something, thinking it would change his life, and being afterwards deceived by the product ? When we see a tv-advertisement, for example, we are giving us an idea of a product that doesn't always correspond to what the product really is. The only way to make this match this idea with reality is to test, and sometimes we are deceived. Why are we fooled by advertisements? The problem lies in the fact that we tend to trust what we perceive at first. An item might seem huge in the picture, but it is in reality tiny. We are also fooled by numbers. Political rhetoric in the public debate is always used by politicians who talk about percentages, but without telling the truth.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I agree with the statement that in twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today for the following reasons. First of all, driving cars will cost more money than other public transport because the price of car fuels, gasoline and gas oil, will be rising. For example, I remember that in 2003 when I was in my first year at Showa-Shell-Sekiyu, a large oil company in Japan, the price of gasoline in the Japanese market was less than one dollar. However now, it is raised about one half dollars. As the above example shows, driving cars will cost more money than other public transport. Second, people will be thinking about the environment more deeply and making a new low that will limit the number of cars. For example when I was an eleventh grader at Okayama Joto High School, a public high school in Japan, I was able to swim in the river next to my high school after school.

title: It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
text: I agree with this opinion. I have some reasons to help my opinion. First, ideas and concepts are always the basis of everything when we make a new product or facts. If someone has only a fact, he/she can use that fact but they can't use proper usage of this fact. We can use our facts to know their ideas and concepts. when I was a child, my uncle gave me an airplane paper craft. I can throw it and it will be flying in the air. It was surely interesting and exciting for me but I couldn't understand why it could fly. It is a childish question but I was so serious. So, I learned to know ideas and concepts are so important at that time. In addition, some people feel annoying about facts if they didn't know ideas and concepts. One of my friends will be angry when he can't understand anything. We can say mathematics is also based on ideas and concepts. He was answering a question while we were taking a test, and I guessed he had a question which was hard to understand when an incident happened. Suddenly, he kicked his desk and went out of the office class room.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: I don't think that it will decrease the number of cars in just twenty years. I support my opinion with some reasons I describe below. First, Nowadays, cars are one of the most necessary things in our everyday life. Japanese people sometimes express about cars as "legs" in our conversation. For example, a man says "We don't have legs to go to the station. ", then another man said, "We can take a bus. ". The first man said "lags", but of course, its not about real legs. Ordinary people have their legs, so correctly, he wanted to say about a vehicle, but he exchanged the word into legs. Now, you get an idea how important cars are for us like legs. We will keep driving cars even in twenty years' time. Secondly, everybody thinks cars are convenient. We can move far away, and we don't need to pay for driving without gas or oil. If a new vehicle or machine is invented in the near future, people might change their way of moving, but this invention must be more convenient and cheaper than cars. In addition to this, this story is not reality, so we should ignore this now.

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: To answer that question, we need to ask another question " is success measured by the things we do or how we do things? ", if the answer was "by the things we do" then i disagree , because people will always take risks as a fact of success and not as a choice, the reason behind that is that people tend and rather feel safe than to take risks with a big possibility of failure, for example: if there is a shoemaker who worked in that field for almost twenty years and has no experience what so ever in any other field, then that man has two choices, to continue his work knowing that its a failure - we agreed that success is measured by "the things we do " Fundamentally this man will have a very low rate of success, and may lose his fortune by changing the work he does to things he does  not. At the same time this man wanted success and that is what we all want, so in fact he had no choice, he had to follow that path. If that was the case, we would find that many of the businesses would collapse because of the shifting of fields done by non-skilled people, the doctor wants to be a pilot, the accountant wants to be an engineer and the cat wants to be the mouse.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: "In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. "I do not agree with this statement. The reasons are the following: 1. As the year goes on technology will improve and this will result in manufacturing good cars at much cheaper rates than today. So as the price of cars decreases more consumers will buy cars. This is the simple Demand - Supply principle of Economics. 2. Also population of the world is continuously increasing. The more users there will be and they will use more cars. This will imply the usage of more cars than in today's era. 3. Cars are means of transport. In twenty years business will grow rapidly in differentareas. More packages will have to be delivered or transferred. So this will result in a larger number of transfers hence an increase in the number of cars. 4. In the next twenty years fashion/glamour will also increase.

This will imply the usage of more cars than in today\'s era. 3. Cars are means of transport. In twenty years business will grow rapidly in differentareas. More packages will have to be delivered or transferred. So this will result in a larger number of transfers hence an increase in the number of cars. 4.', 'In the next twenty years fashion/glamour will also increase.']

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Nowadays, there is a great generation gap between young people and older people. Sometimes they are quite distinguished from others. It was generally agreed that Young people enjoy life more than older people do. But in my opinion, I don't agree with the opinion. In the first place, many young people enjoy their life so much. They are very modern and familiar with all the new-coming products. For instance, the internet, electronic products, and new conventions are made great use of by them. They realize what the real world is and have their ideal life style. Their idea is to make the world colorful, fun and full of significance. Only by doing things for society can they feel real happiness. In contrast, there still remains a large number of young people who are doing nothing everyday. If they were asked what they were doing, they would answer they were enjoying themselves. They drink, do sports, play computer games ,change boyfriends frequently ,rob money or small items from children and do whatever they can.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: THE OLDER THE PEOPLE, THE MORE ENJOYABLE THE LIFE 	Some people believe that young people have a lot more to do with life than older people whereas some others think that it is the opposite. I guess as a young person I am in that second group thinking that older people enjoy life better than we young people do for a number of reasons like having more free time, more awareness about the value of the time concept and having better financial conditions. People are born, grow a little and start school in a normal life cycle.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: I agree with this statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. I have bought many products so far, and I am going to have to buy many products in the future. In my opinion, there are many products which are different from my image. When we watch TV, we see many advertisements, and most products we see on TV are very attractive to us. Companies which make products are in competitive situations everyday. They have to make better products than other companies. Advertisements are very important for these companies to sell all products. Therefore, these companies have to make attractive advertisements even though the product is only about good things. This is their business. I usually decide to buy products when I see the advertisement. However, when I went to a store and saw the product, I sometimes thought that it was different from my image. Finally, I gave up buying the product. It happens sometimes. Therefore, products are not necessary the same as the advertisements. When the products are not the same as our images, it makes us disappointed. Therefore, I agree with this statement. Most advertisements are made to attract people.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Young people are full of energy and in possession of an active body and a healthy mind. They really enjoy life much more than older people. who are weak and frail. Young people can go for what they want to do. They have the vigour, stamina, active brain, sound health and energy to achieve their goals. While, senility makes a person dull and it also comes with many diseases, which leave their body inactive. If a young person has a desire to take a world tour then he can go for it. But, such ideas have to "nipped in the bud" by older people. They will not enjoy such an adventure, but will create problems for them and their relatives. You are in demand if you are in the possession of a young body, a young soul. That makes life enjoyable for a young person. He feels he is wanted by society, by friends and family. On the other hand, older people are ignored by most of them. Most of the time they have to either read something or sit infront of theTV. These all tasks make their life a bore. Older people's lives are like a train which has got an engine only and that engine is also malfunctioned and can stall anytime. Selinity also brings a kind of fear, discipline, misery, responsibilities, in older people's lives. They all contribute to stopping older people from having fun. They have had a bad experience with most of the tasks which are enjoyed by young people. They, therefore dont dare to go for those activities once again. While young people follow the quote, " rules are made to be broken" They go for it and thus enjoylife. In sum, it is not that older people don't enjoy it at all but there are restrictions, which dont apply to young people. This world and it's circumstances give much more opportunities for young people to enjoy their life. Old age takes away most of those opportunities. extent.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Some people believe that the products in advertisements are the same as the real ones because they look like the real ones. However, I do not agree with it. I believe most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are because of well-taken pictures and the strategy of companies. First of all, well-taken pictures are very attractive. The purpose of advertising is to show the products well to people. For performing that purpose, the products in advertisements should be in good shape. A friend of mine, he works in an advertisement company in Korea. One day, he showed me two pictures of apples. One was just a regular picture and the other one was a picture that he added some color balance with photoshop. Two pictures were totally different from each other, and he said that his company would use the latter picture for the apple advertisement. For this reason, I believe that the goods in advertisements are in better shape than the real ones. Moreover, advertising should make people want the products, and that is the strategy of advertisements. For letting people buy the goods, the advertisements have to use any way to attract people even if they exaggerate. One day, I saw the advertisements for Kim-chi, Korean traditional food, on television shopping.
sents: ['Some people believe that the products in advertisements are the same as the real ones because they look like the real ones. However, I do not agree with it. I believe most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are because of well-taken pictures and the strategy of companies. First of all, well-taken pictures are very attractive. The purpose of advertising is to show the products well to people. For performing that purpose, the products in advertisements should be in good shape. A friend of mine, he works in an advertisement company in Korea. One day, he showed me two pictures of apples. One was just a regular picture and the other one was a picture that he added some color balance with photoshop. Two pictures were totally different from each other, and he said that his company would use the latter picture for the apple advertisement. For this reason, I believe that the goods in advertisements are in better shape than the real ones. Moreover, advertising should make people want the products, and that is the strategy of advertisements. For letting people buy the goods, the advertisements have to use any way to attract people even if they exaggerate.', 'One day, I saw the advertisements for Kim-chi, Korean traditional food, on television shopping.']

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: I am completely positive about the statement. Here i would like to mention some reasons why group travel is the best way to travel. I work for a travel company as a tour guide, so i guess i confirm the advantages of group travelling. First of all, tourists feel secure when they are travelling with plenty of people and their guide, who is a local resident of the site. Group travelling people can defend themselves in difficult times and it is more likely to attract public attention for requesting help. In some places, it is suggested to tourists not to go out alone because of the high velocity rate. The second reason why i prefer group travel is payment for the travel costs. Needless to say, it is noticably cheaper than single travel for certain countries. Even a number of tour companies offer special programmes for group tourists, not only discounts, but also free-of-charge trips for group leaders or a certain number of members. The third reason serves our company's main goal, More people, more fun. It is very interesting to travel with many different people in order to have a real vacation. Group tourists can attend different competitions, matches and other attractive entertainment. Travelling is not only the meaning of travelling, but of making friends and getting relationships with them. It offers people more chances to make friends in an easier way. I know of many occasions when tourists get married after a long, exciting tour.
